Dear Ms. Bland:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
7/7/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4146 Immunizations.
(1) A resident shall have current immunizations as required
by the department of community health.
One of six case files reviewed had an overdue immunization. It was noted that the
immunization became overdue prior to the facility accepting placement. However,
the facility recognized they did not document any steps taken to bring the
immunizations up to date after placement occurred.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
Rule 146 Immunizations- the agency was advised that when accepting placement,
they should document steps taken to update any already overdue immunizations, or
obtain documentation waiving the immunization.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following area:
The facility passed fire and environmental inspections with “A” ratings and was
observed to be clean and safe. Although, it was noted that the age of the building is a
challenge; wear and tear over the years creates an ongoing need for maintenance
and updates. If the agency’s long-term plan is to remain in this building, the
Administrator was encouraged to continue efforts to update and refresh the building.
It was noted that new paint and furniture were recently used to renovate a meeting

space in the gym building. The facility would benefit from this type of update
throughout.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
After recommendation, but prior to issuance of the 1st Provisional license, SIR
2021C0108020 was initiated on 1/27/21. The investigation concluded on 2/8/21 and
determined violations regarding rule 142 (1e) Dispensing medication, 142 (1c)
Documentation of medical care and maintenance of health records, and 142 (1a)
Routine and emergency medical care. A CAP was approved on 3/4/21. As of this
renewal evaluation, the facility continues to follow the CAP and no further violations
were found. Monitoring of the CAP will be ongoing by DCWL.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules, ISEP requirements, or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued
a renewal of their regular license.
